This spell functions like @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.3vvdCXWRAdvhvmuq]{Physical Stability}, except as noted above

Physical Stability

Drawing upon the order and stability of the lawful outer planes, you stabilize a creatureâ€™s form with a touch. The target gains a +2 circumstance bonus against transmutation spells and effects. Physical stability counters @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.kzOemsOWuqgbbGZw]{Baleful Polymorph} and @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.gNgdSyi4pXQmasmc]{Polymorph}, and it counters and negates @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.xledsFeEKm5em0Dt]{Fluidity Of Form}. If you cast physical stability on a creature already under the effects of a transmutation effect, you can try to dispel one transmutation effect affecting the target. If you do, attempt a dispel check (1d20 + caster level) with a DC equal to 11 + the caster level of the transmutation effect to end the effect.

target.value: up to one creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
